Job Position: Electrical Engineer - Level I

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking an enthusiastic and detail-oriented Electrical Engineer (Level 1) to join our engineering and site delivery team. The successful candidate will assist in preparing workshop drawings, provide on-site technical support, and ensure that all electrical work complies with approved project specifications and standards.
	This is an excellent opportunity for an entry-level engineer who wants to grow in electrical design, construction, and project execution within a dynamic organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in the preparation and filing of workshop drawings and related documentation.
	Support the implementation and monitoring of electrical work on-site under guidance.
	Interpret and execute workshop drawings accurately.
	Submit site reports, inspection requests, and progress updates as required.
	Provide technical support to site workers and subcontractors.
	Ensure all work complies with approved drawings, specifications, and safety standards.
	Carry out any other related duties assigned by the project engineer or supervisor.


Health, Safety &amp; Environmental (OHSE) Responsibilities:


	Follow all company health and safety procedures.
	Use personal protective equipment (PPE) and obey safety signage at all times.
	Report identified defects, incidents, or potential hazards immediately.
	Participate in toolbox talks and safety briefings.
	Promote a safe, sustainable, and environmentally responsible workplace.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
	0&ndash;2 years of relevant experience (fresh graduates encouraged to apply).
	Exposure to construction or engineering projects will be an advantage.


Skills &amp; Abilities:


	Strong teamwork and communication skills.
	Ability to interpret and understand electrical drawings.
	Good coordination and organizational abilities.
	Detail-oriented and proactive learner.
	Ability to work under supervision while meeting deadlines.


Knowledge &amp; Technical Requirements:


	Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.
	Basic proficiency in AutoCAD.
	Understanding of general electrical principles and standards.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and career-growth opportunities.
	Mentorship and continuous professional development.
	Exposure to multidisciplinary electrical projects.
	A collaborative and safety-driven work culture.


Method of Application

Electrical Engineer - Level I Job at Fort Knox Outsourcing




        
    

        
        Fort Knox Outsourcing was set up to cater to the growing need of businesses in Nigeria to reap the economic, strategic and operational benefits offered by outsourcing. We act as a “Third Party Service Provider” that Source, Select, and Second employment ready workforce in line with client specifications to meet their talent needs as quickly as possible!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer - Level I

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are seeking an enthusiastic and detail-oriented Electrical Engineer (Level 1) to join our engineering and site delivery team. The successful candidate will assist in preparing workshop drawings, provide on-site technical support, and ensure that all electrical work complies with approved project specifications and standards.
	This is an excellent opportunity for an entry-level engineer who wants to grow in electrical design, construction, and project execution within a dynamic organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in the preparation and filing of workshop drawings and related documentation.
	Support the implementation and monitoring of electrical work on-site under guidance.
	Interpret and execute workshop drawings accurately.
	Submit site reports, inspection requests, and progress updates as required.
	Provide technical support to site workers and subcontractors.
	Ensure all work complies with approved drawings, specifications, and safety standards.
	Carry out any other related duties assigned by the project engineer or supervisor.


Health, Safety & Environmental (OHSE) Responsibilities:


	Follow all company health and safety procedures.
	Use personal protective equipment (PPE) and obey safety signage at all times.
	Report identified defects, incidents, or potential hazards immediately.
	Participate in toolbox talks and safety briefings.
	Promote a safe, sustainable, and environmentally responsible workplace.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
	0–2 years of relevant experience (fresh graduates encouraged to apply).
	Exposure to construction or engineering projects will be an advantage.


Skills & Abilities:


	Strong teamwork and communication skills.
	Ability to interpret and understand electrical drawings.
	Good coordination and organizational abilities.
	Detail-oriented and proactive learner.
	Ability to work under supervision while meeting deadlines.


Knowledge & Technical Requirements:


	Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.
	Basic proficiency in AutoCAD.
	Understanding of general electrical principles and standards.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and career-growth opportunities.
	Mentorship and continuous professional development.
	Exposure to multidisciplinary electrical projects.
	A collaborative and safety-driven work culture.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to recruitment@fortknoxoutsourcing.com using "Electrical Engineer – Level 1" as the subject of the email.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Rigs Operations Engineer",
  "description": "Nestoil Plc was incorporated in Nigeria in 1991 for the provision of Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) services to the energy and oil &amp; gas industry. Since then, Nestoil has grown to become the leading indigenous EPC provider for major IOCs (International Oil Companies) in Sub-Saharan Africa like National Petroleum Company (NNPC) Shell, Exxon Mobil, Chevron, Total, etc.

Our Strategic Business Unit (SBU), Scorpio Drilling International Limited, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Rigs Operations Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Warri, Delta

Job Description


	We are on an evolutionary journey where we are changing our story. We are looking to hire an experienced&nbsp;Rigs Operations Engineer&nbsp;to join our diverse team in our Company.
	In this role, you will be responsible to will support the planning, coordination, and execution of drilling operations to ensure safe, cost-efficient, and high-quality service delivery.
	The role involves providing technical expertise, ensuring compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements, optimizing drilling performance, and liaising with internal and external stakeholders to achieve operational excellence.


Responsibilities
As a Rigs Operations Engineer, you will be responsible to:


	Assist in planning and scheduling daily rig operations.
	Monitor and analyze drilling performance and provide recommendations for optimization.
	Ensure proper allocation of equipment, materials, and personnel to meet operational requirements&nbsp;
	Ensure proper use and maintenance of drilling equipment and tools.

Rigs Operations Engineer Job at Nestoil Plc




        
    

        
        Nestoil Plc was incorporated in Nigeria in 1991 for the provision of Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) services to the energy and oil & gas industry. Since then, Nestoil has grown to become the leading indigenous EPC provider for major IOCs (International Oil Companies) in Sub-Saharan Africa like National Petroleum Company (NNPC) Shell, Exxon Mobil, Chevron, Total, etc.

Our Strategic Business Unit (SBU), Scorpio Drilling International Limited, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Rigs Operations Engineer

Job Location: Warri, Delta

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are on an evolutionary journey where we are changing our story. We are looking to hire an experienced Rigs Operations Engineer to join our diverse team in our Company.
	In this role, you will be responsible to will support the planning, coordination, and execution of drilling operations to ensure safe, cost-efficient, and high-quality service delivery.
	The role involves providing technical expertise, ensuring compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements, optimizing drilling performance, and liaising with internal and external stakeholders to achieve operational excellence.


Responsibilities
As a Rigs Operations Engineer, you will be responsible to:


	Assist in planning and scheduling daily rig operations.
	Monitor and analyze drilling performance and provide recommendations for optimization.
	Ensure proper allocation of equipment, materials, and personnel to meet operational requirements 
	Ensure proper use and maintenance of drilling equipment and tools.
	Assist in cost estimation, budgeting, and performance analysis of drilling operations.
	 Ensure compliance with HSE standards, company policies, and statutory regulations.
	Participate in risk assessments, safety audits, and incident investigations and promote a strong safety culture on rigs and within the operations team.
	Support emergency response and contingency planning and co-ordinate with rig crew, service providers, and contractors to ensure seamless operations.
	Maintain effective communication between field teams and office management 
	Participate in contractor performance evaluations and audits.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly operational reports for management.
	Track and analyze key operational KPIs (NPT, downtime, cost per well, safety records).
	Maintain accurate documentation of well operations, equipment use, and lessons learned.  


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Petroleum Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or related discipline
	Minimum of 5+ years of relevant experience in drilling operations, preferably with a drilling contractor.
	IWCF (International Well Control Forum) Certification-Supervisor level; BOSIET / HUET
	Strong knowledge of rig operations, and well construction.
	Proficient in MS Office and drilling software applications
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
	Strong safety awareness and ability to enforce HSE policies.
	Willingness to work offshore/onshore rotation and travel as required.
